paper_abstract: The most widely used progress measure for branch-and-bound (B&B) algorithms when solving mixed-integer programs (MIPs) is the MIP gap. We introduce a new progress measure that is often much smoother than the MIP gap. We propose a double exponential smoothing technique to predict the solution time of B&B algorithms and evaluate the prediction method using three MIP solvers. Our computational experiments show that accurate predictions of the solution time are possible, even in the early stages of B&B algorithms.
paper_title: Predicting the Solution Time of Branch-and-Bound Algorithms for Mixed-Integer Programs
